definition: to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery

sentences.english: They're cheap, a few bucks at the most.
sentences.chinese: 蒸籠很便宜，最多幾美元。

sentences.english: Steam the glutinous rice in a wok or steamer.
sentences.chinese: 將糯米放在鑊或蒸籠上蒸熟。

sentences.english: He said i was gonna have a ball on the steamer?
sentences.chinese: 他說我要去有一個蒸籠球嗎？

sentences.english: Produced process is laying the pulp mill of the rice noodle on the bamboo steamer to steam.
sentences.chinese: 製作時，將磨好的米粉漿平鋪於竹蒸籠上蒸制。

sentences.english: Set a steamer basket in the skillet, and arrange fillets in basket.
sentences.chinese: 將魚片擺放於一個蒸籠裏上鍋蒸。

sentences.english: Steamer one opened, red yeast rice aroma first aroma.
sentences.chinese: 蒸籠一掀開，紅麴香味先撲鼻。

sentences.english: Invest in a wire steamer rack, also called a steamer insert.
sentences.chinese: 買一個金屬絲制的蒸架，又叫蒸籠。

sentences.english: It's very hot today; I am quite baked up.
sentences.chinese: 今天真熱，我像在蒸籠裏被烤似的。

sentences.english: I want to float in cool waters and forget about the heat wave in steaming New York City.
sentences.chinese: 我想在清涼的水裏浮游，忘記紐約蒸籠裏的熱浪。

sentences.english: The glutinous food uses the wooden steamer to steam the system generally.
sentences.chinese: 糯飯一般均用木製的蒸籠來蒸制。

sentences.english: If the socks still stink after soaking, sit them in the steamer.
sentences.chinese: 如果短襪浸過後仍然臭，把它們放在蒸籠裏。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
rice ball (steamed rice formed into a ball and stuffed with various fillings)/onigiri (Japanese-style rice ball)
plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
